howToUse.title: How to Use the Salary Hike Calculator

inputFields.title: Input Fields
items: Select calculation mode: Find New Salary by Hike Percentage or Find Hike Percentage by Salary
Enter hike percentage or new salary depending on the mode
The calculator will automatically calculate the results

items.description: Hike Percentage = (New Salary - Current Salary) / Current Salary × 100
New Salary = Current Salary × (1 + Hike Percentage / 100)
Salary Increase = New Salary - Current Salary

tips.title: Tips for Accurate Results
items: Enter annual salary amounts for accurate calculations
Use the same currency for both current and new salary
Consider all components of your salary package
Use the quick hike buttons for common percentages
Compare different hike scenarios for better planning

formula.title: Salary Hike Formula
formula.description: The salary hike percentage is calculated by finding the difference between new and current salary, dividing by the current salary, and multiplying by 100 to get the percentage increase.

interpretation.title: Hike Interpretation
interpretation.description: Salary hikes are categorized based on percentage increase: 0% (No Hike), 1-5% (Low Hike), 5-10% (Moderate Hike), 10-20% (Good Hike), 20-30% (Excellent Hike), and 30%+ (Exceptional Hike).

importance.title: Why Salary Hike Calculator is Important
importance.description: A Salary Hike Calculator helps employees and employers understand the impact of salary adjustments. It provides clarity for salary negotiations, performance reviews, and financial planning by quantifying the percentage increase and its monetary value.
